Member (type, method, property, etc.) ID as used in documentation comments

Return value

string
The link to online MS documentation when the link is available and such links are allowed in configuration. Otherwise, return null

Go to namespaces or types

MsApiDocEngine.GetLink(TypeRef) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.MsApiDoc
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: MsApiDocEngine
Sources: MsApiDoc\MsApiDocEngine.cs

Retrieves the link to MS API online documentation based on the typeRef .

public static string GetLink(TypeRef typeRef)
Method parameters
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.CodeModel.TypeRef typeRef
Type reference to get the link for

Return value

string
The link to online MS documentation when the link is available and such links are allowed in configuration. Otherwise, return null

Remarks

As the query is based on the TypeRef , it's applicable to types only (the meaning of "type" includes interfaces, structures, delegates, etc.). In this case, the links can be also created based on the namespace and name when the local doc is not available or the item has not been found in the internal dictionary. This can be suppressed by setting the configuration option RequireLocalDoc to true.

Go to namespaces or types

MsApiDocEngine.ReadLocalDoc() Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.MsApiDoc
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: MsApiDocEngine
Sources: MsApiDoc\MsApiDocEngine.cs

Reads the local clone of MS .NET API documentation and builds the internal dictionary of member IDs and links to MS online API documentation

public static bool ReadLocalDoc()

Return value

bool
True when the local documentation has been read, otherwise false (the errors are "soft" - provided to console standard output as warnings)

Remarks

Path to the local clone od MS documentation is taken from configuration LocalDocDir . Directory must contain xml\FrameworksIndex subdirectory. This directory contains the indexes for different frameworks (.NET frameworks, .NET standard, ...). For the simplicity, the biggest index (XML) file is used as a source. The index file contains records like 

     <Namespace Name="Microsoft.CSharp">
         <Type Name = "Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider" Id="T:Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider">
            <Member Id = "M:Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider.#ctor" />
            <Member Id="M:Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})" />
            <Member Id = "M:Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider.CreateCompiler" />
            <Member Id="M:Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider.CreateGenerator" />
            <Member Id = "M:Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider.GenerateCodeFromMember(System.CodeDom.CodeTypeMember,System.IO.TextWriter,System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions)" />
            <Member Id="M:Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider.GetConverter(System.Type)" />
            <Member Id = "P:Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider.FileExtension" />
         </Type >
     </Namespace >
The method gets all type and (type) member ID and generates the links for them. The links are created based on the "observation" how they are composed at the MS API site, so it's best effort approach and the links are not granted to be hundred percent correct. The base URL is set in ApiBaseUrl (the base URL must end with "/").

Go to namespaces or types

MsApiDocEngine.TypeMemberBaseName(string) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.MsApiDoc
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: MsApiDocEngine
Sources: MsApiDoc\MsApiDocEngine.cs

Extracts the base name for the type member.

private static string TypeMemberBaseName(string str)
Method parameters
string str
Name of the type member

Return value

string
Base name for the type member

Remarks

Single member page can contain multiple overloads, so it's necessary to extract the base name that will be used as a part of the link. The particular overload is then identified by anchor.

Go to namespaces or types

MsApiDocOptions.RequireLocalDoc Property

Type: MsApiDocOptions
Sources: MsApiDoc\MsApiDocOptions.cs

Flag whether to build the links based on the local close of .NET API Documentation only.

public bool RequireLocalDoc { get; set; }

Property value

bool

Remarks

If not set (is false), MsApiDocEngine will try to build the links for TypeRef , the links based on documentation ID will not be created

Note: This will not suppress reading/using the links based on the local clone of the documentation, just the "fallback" will be disabled

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options Namespace

Configuration container and output options classes

Classes

NameModifierSummary
ConfigurationpublicSingleton holding the application configuration (options)
Configuration.ConfigurationBuilderpublicConfiguration builder providing the methods for adding the configuration items from individual sources
OutputOptionspublicOutput configuration

Go to namespaces or types

Configuration Class

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Sources: Options\Configuration.cs

Singleton holding the application configuration (options)

public sealed class Configuration

Inheritance: object

Remarks

This is the simple configuration container in case DI with more sophisticated containers is not used The configuration is stored as the key-value dictionary, supporting hierarchy using the dot separator and arrays.The arrays can contain values or another objects. Actually, mixed arrays of values and objects can be stored, but they are not supported for binding.

For example section1.option1 means the option1 available in section1, section1.subSection2.option1 means the option1 available in section1.subSection2. section1.option1[0] means, that the option1 is array of values or objects (sections) within the section1. For arrays, the keys are like OtherSection.SimpleArray[0] or OtherSection.ComplexObjectArray[0].Name

Configuration class provides a singleton instance, however the key functionality is provided via static functions, so no need to touch the Instance at all. The items can be retrieved by key using the Get(string) and Get<TValueType>(string, Configuration.TValueType) methods. The first one returns null when the key is not found, the other one allow to define the default value to be returned, when the item is not found.

The inner class Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder provides the methods to build the configuration from JSON config files, commandline arguments, environment values and/or direct entries. The static method Builder() clears the configuration items and binding cache and creates a new instance of Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder allowing to build a configuration from scratch. The configuration is updated directly during the calls to builder methods, the existing items (keys) are updated, so it's possible to manage the priority of individual sources and the overrides if needed. The method Build() returns the configuration instance, breaking the fluent design of builder methods, however there is no other functionality within the method, so it's more the convention than need to use it at the end of configuration build.

Configuration binding it the way, how to access the configuration using the configuration objects instead of querying the individual items by key. When the method Bind<TOptionsContainer>(string, bool) is used, it creates a new instance of given type and tries to map the public properties with public setter to the keys (using the "dot notation") within the Configuration . It's possible to bind the object to to the root of the configuration to provide the whole configuration at once or bind it to the particular section to provide a configuration sub-tree. In general, the nested objects and both value and object arrays are supported. There are some rules when binding the arrays: The index must start with zero and must be in sequence (the first non-existing index stops the evaluation). The array should not mix the array or values and array of objects. The decision is made at the first item (index=0) whether it's value or object.

The implementation of binding treats the System.Boolean values the special way - if there is no value, but existing key, the value is converted to true. This is useful when the command line arguments are used like flags. For example having the argument -p:SkipStep1 and prefix -p: , the binding a bool property SkipStep1 will set the value of the property to true (doesn't change the configuration item itself). Of course, it's still possible to use the syntax -p:SkipStep1=true or -p:SkipStep1=false even in this case.

As the binding uses the reflection, it's quite expensive operation, so by default, the bound objects are cached (the cache key is the type of bound object, so binding the same type to different sections is not recommended ). It's possible to force the binding using the parameter of Bind<TOptionsContainer>(string, bool) method. In general, the recommended pattern is to Bind<TOptionsContainer>(string, bool) the configuration object after the configuration is built and then Retrieve<TOptionsContainer>() it from the cache when needed.

Fields

NameModifierSummary
bindingsCacheprivateCache for bindings. Dictionary of type bound as a key and the bound object as value.
instanceprivate staticInstance of the Configuration created when the singleton is first touched

Properties

NameModifierSummary
Instancepublic staticPublic Configuration instance
ItemsprivateConfiguration items stored as key-value pairs

Constructors

NameModifierSummary
Configuration()private staticStatic constructor
Configuration()privatePrivate constructor used to build the singleton instance

Methods

NameModifierSummary
AddOrUpdateItem(string, object)privateAdd a new configuration item with given value or updates its value if the key already exists.
Bind(Type, string)private staticCreates a new object with given type and binds the configuration to its public properties where possible.
Bind<TOptionsContainer>(string, bool)public staticBinds the configuration to given TOptionsContainer type and returns the bound object of such type. The resulting configuration object is stored to the cache and can be later on retrieved using Retrieve<TOptionsContainer>()
Builder()public staticClears the configuration items and binding cache and creates a new instance of Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
Get(string)public staticGets the configuration item by key
Get<TValueType>(string, Configuration.TValueType)public staticGets the typed configuration item by key . Returns the default value, that can be provided or is default to given TValueType The function tries to convert the value to TValueType using System.Convert.ChangeType(System.Object,System.Type) if the conversion is not successful, the default is returned.
GetSection(string)private staticGets the configuration sub-tree that belongs to given section. The keys returned are relative to given section! When the section is not provided, the whole configuration tree is returned.
Retrieve<TOptionsContainer>()public staticRetrieves the configuration object of given TOptionsContainer that has been bound and cached before. The new instance of TOptionsContainer is created when the type not found in cache
TryConvertValue(Type, object, object)private staticTries to convert sourceValue to targetType . The converted values is returned in targetValue out parameter, the result of conversion is the function return value.

Go to namespaces or types

Configuration.bindingsCache Field

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Configuration
Sources: Options\Configuration.cs

Cache for bindings. Dictionary of type bound as a key and the bound object as value.

private readonly ConcurrentDictionary<System.Type,object> bindingsCache

Field value

System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary<System.Type,object>

Remarks

Cache is used to prevent the "expensive" binding operation in case there is no need to refresh the bound configuration object

private static Dictionary<string,object> GetSection(string sectionName = null)

Configuration.TryConvertValue(Type, object, object) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Configuration
Sources: Options\Configuration.cs

Tries to convert sourceValue to targetType . The converted values is returned in targetValue out parameter, the result of conversion is the function return value.

private static bool TryConvertValue(Type targetType, object sourceValue, out object targetValue)
Method parameters
System.Type targetType
Target (property) type
object sourceValue
Source value as stored in configuration item
object targetValue
sourceValue converted to targetType when the conversion succeeded (return value is true) or source value otherwise

Return value

bool
The result or conversion. If true, the targetValue can be set to property having targetType

Remarks

The implementation treats the System.Boolean values the special way - if there is no value, but existing key, the value is converted to true.

Go to namespaces or types

Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder Class

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Sources: Options\Configuration.cs

Configuration builder providing the methods for adding the configuration items from individual sources

public class Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder

Inheritance: object

Methods

NameModifierSummary
Add(string, object)publicAdd a new configuration item with given value or updates its value if the key already exists.
AddCommandLineArguments(string[])publicAdds the command line arguments starting with prefixes into the Configuration . When a configuration item exists, the value is updated.
AddEnvironmentVariables()publicAdds all environment variables into the Configuration . When a configuration item exists, the value is updated.
AddJsonFile(string, bool, bool)publicLoads the configuration items from JSON file, keeping the hierarchy of JSON objects (and arrays) When a configuration item exists, the value is updated.

Go to namespaces or types

Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder.Add(string, object) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
Sources: Options\Configuration.cs

Add a new configuration item with given value or updates its value if the key already exists.

public Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder Add(string key, object value)
Method parameters
string key
Configuration item key
object value
The value to be set for the configuration item

Return value

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options.Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
The current Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder

Go to namespaces or types

Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder.AddCommandLineArguments(string[]) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
Sources: Options\Configuration.cs

Adds the command line arguments starting with prefixes into the Configuration . When a configuration item exists, the value is updated.

public Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder AddCommandLineArguments(params string[] prefixes)
Method parameters
string[] prefixes
Optional list of prefixes marking the command line arguments to be the configuration items

Return value

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options.Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
The current Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder

Remarks

The command line arguments have the syntax key=value (for example Key1=Option1 or prefixkey=value (for example -p:Key1=Option1 where -p: is the prefix). When the prefixes are not provided, all command line arguments are added to the configuration. When the prefixes are provided,the prefix is not a part of the key.

The implementation of binding treats the System.Boolean values the special way - if there is no value, but existing key, the value is converted to true, allowing to use the parameters like flags. For example having the argument -p:SkipStep1 and prefix -p: , the binding a bool property SkipStep1 will set the value of the property to true (doesn't change the configuration item itself). Of course, it's still possible to use the syntax -p:SkipStep1=true or -p:SkipStep1=false even in this case.

Go to namespaces or types

Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder.AddEnvironmentVariables() Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
Sources: Options\Configuration.cs

Adds all environment variables into the Configuration . When a configuration item exists, the value is updated.

public Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder AddEnvironmentVariables()

Return value

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options.Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
The current Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder

Remarks

The name of the environment variable is used as a key to the configuration item. Use the "dot notation" in variable names to support the configuration hierarchy.

Go to namespaces or types

Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder.AddJsonFile(string, bool, bool) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
Sources: Options\Configuration.cs

Loads the configuration items from JSON file, keeping the hierarchy of JSON objects (and arrays) When a configuration item exists, the value is updated.

public Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder AddJsonFile(string fileName, bool ignoreNullOrEmptyFileName = false, bool ignoreIfNotExist = false)
Method parameters
string fileName
Name of the JSON file with configuration
bool ignoreNullOrEmptyFileName
If true, the missing file name will not throw the exception and the method just "silently" ends.
bool ignoreIfNotExist
If true, the non existing file will not throw the exception and the method just "silently" ends.

Return value

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Options.Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder
The current Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder

IsNewUtils.GetIsNew(ISymbol) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Utils
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: IsNewUtils
Sources: Utils\IsNewUtils.cs

Gets the value of internal IsNew property of given symbol

public static bool GetIsNew(this ISymbol symbol)
Method parameters
Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol symbol
Symbol to get the value from

Return value

bool
Value of internal IsNew property of given symbol or false when the property can't be retrieved

Remarks

Uses the reflection to get the access to the internal property IsNew. The retrieved System.Reflection.PropertyInfo is cached in IsNewPropertyCache to minimize the performance impacts.

Text builder

public class Txt

Inheritance: object

Fields

NameModifierSummary
builderprivateInternal System.Text.StringBuilder

Constructors

NameModifierSummary
Txt()publicCreates a new empty text builder
Txt(string)publicCreates a new text builder with initial text

Methods

NameModifierSummary
Add(Func<string>)publicAdds the text returned from textFunc to the text builder
Add(string)publicAdds the text to the text builder
AddEach<TItemType>(Func<TItemType,string>, IEnumerable<TItemType>, string)publicAdds the returned from textFunc for each items from items to the text builder.
AddEachIf<TItemType>(Func<TItemType,string>, IEnumerable<TItemType>, bool, string)publicAdds the returned from textFunc for each items from items to the text builder when the condition is true.
AddIf(Func<string>, bool)publicAdds the text returned from textFunc to the text builder when the condition is true.
AddIf(string, bool)publicAdds the text to the text builder when the condition is true.
Clear()publicClear the text builder
Start(string)public staticCreates a new instance ot Txt text builder with optional initial text
ToString()publicReturns the text content of the text builder

Operators and Conversions

NameModifierSummary
Add(Txt, Txt)public staticConcatenates the contents of two text builders
BitwiseOr(Txt, Txt)public staticConcatenates the contents of two text builders
From(string)public staticCreates a new instance ot Txt text builder with optional initial text
ToString(Txt)public staticConverts the text builder to string containing its content

Txt.Txt() Constructor

Sources: Utils\Txt.cs

Assembly: MarkupDoc

Sources: Utils\Txt.cs

Adds the returned from textFunc for each items from items to the text builder when the condition is true.

public Txt AddEachIf<TItemType>(Func<TItemType,string> textFunc, IEnumerable<TItemType> items, bool condition, string separator = null)
Type parameters
TItemType
Method parameters
System.Func<TItemType,string> textFunc
Function generating the text to add
IEnumerable<TItemType> items
Items to generate the output for via textFunc
bool condition
Condition that must be true to add the textFunc
string separator
Optional separator

Return value

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Utils.Txt
Itself

Remarks

The condition is evaluated once at the beginning of method execution, not for each item.

Go to namespaces or types

Txt.AddIf(Func<string>, bool) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Utils
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Txt
Sources: Utils\Txt.cs

Adds the text returned from textFunc to the text builder when the condition is true.

public Txt AddIf(Func<string> textFunc, bool condition)
Method parameters
System.Func<string> textFunc
Function generating the text to add
bool condition
Condition that must be true to add the textFunc

Return value

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Utils.Txt
Itself

Go to namespaces or types

Txt.AddIf(string, bool) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Utils
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Txt
Sources: Utils\Txt.cs

Adds the text to the text builder when the condition is true.

public Txt AddIf(string text, bool condition)
Method parameters
string text
Text to add
bool condition
Condition that must be true to add the text

Return value

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Utils.Txt
Itself

Remarks

If using some code/variable to generate the text (for example AddIf(obj.Container.Text, obj.Container != null) , the parameter will be evaluated even if the condition is not true ! So the example here will throw NPE when the obj.Container is null. Use AddIf(Func<string>, bool) ( AddIf(()=>obj.Container.Text, obj.Container != null) ) when the function should not be evaluated. Of course AddIf(obj?.Container?.Text, obj?.Container != null) null checks are also valid solution.

Go to namespaces or types

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation Namespace

XML Comment Documentation DTO classes

NameModifierSummary
CpublicClass representing <c> element of XML Documentation Comments
CodepublicClass representing <code> element of XML Documentation Comments

ExceptionDocpublicClass representing <exception> element of XML Documentation Comments
InheritdocpublicClass representing the inheritdoc element of XML Documentation Comments
ListpublicClass representing <list> element of XML Documentation Comments
ListItempublicClass representing <item> and <listheader> elements of XML Documentation Comments
ModelElementpublicBase class for the XML Documentation Comments elements and nodes It's inherited by "known" nodes/elements, itself instanciated when the node/element is not recognized (known).
ModelElementWithCrefpublic abstractAbstract class representing the element of XML Documentation Comments that have the cref attribute
ModelElementWithCrefSimplepublic abstractAbstract class representing the element of XML Documentation Comments that have the cref attribute and simple rendering logic - just the link and/or content

Go to namespaces or types

Code.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: Code
Sources: XmlDocumentation\Code.cs

Renders the Code and its content to string containing the markup provided by markupProvider

protected override string RenderElement(IMarkupProvider markupProvider, Member member, bool trim = true)
Method parameters
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Markup.IMarkupProvider markupProvider
IMarkupProvider allowing using the markup within the rendered content
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.CodeModel.Member member
Code model Member to render the XML Documentation Comment for
bool trim
Flag whether to (full) trim the rendered content

Return value

string
Rendered content of <code> element of XML Documentation Comments
Overrides: ModelElement.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool)

Remarks

Gets not-trimmed content of the tag and renders it using Code(string, bool) . Replaces the line breaks within the output with TagKeepLineBreak pseudo-tag and spaces with TagKeepSpace pseudo-tag to preserve the whitespace when the parent element is to be rendered (and its content trimmed)

Go to namespaces or types

Documentation Class

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Sources: XmlDocumentation\Documentation.cs

Class representing (internal) <member> element of XML Documentation Comments. Used as a root documentation object for the code model Member

public class Documentation : ModelElement

Inheritance: object -> net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.ModelElement

Remarks

The Documentation class provides the "alias" properties to access the common elements like Summary , Remarks , Exceptions , etc.

Properties

NameModifierSummary
ExamplepublicReturns the first example documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.
ExceptionspublicReturns the exception documentation elements or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.
InheritDocRefpublicOptional inherit doc reference
OwnRefpublicContent of name attribute of member element
RemarkspublicReturns the first remarks documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.
ReturnspublicReturns the first returns documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.
SeeAlsopublicReturns the seealso documentation elements or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.
ShouldInheritDocpublicFlag whether to inherit the documentation
SummarypublicReturns the first summary documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.
ValuepublicReturns the first value documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.

Constructors

NameModifierSummary
Documentation(XElement)publicInitialize Documentation instance from XML Documentation Comments element

Methods

NameModifierSummary
GetExample(Member)publicReturns the first example documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here if applicable.
GetExceptions(Member)publicReturns the exception documentation elements or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here if applicable.
GetMemberBase(Member)privateGets the member to inherit documentation from if available
GetParam(Member, string)publicReturns the first param documentation element with given name or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here.
GetRemarks(Member)publicReturns the first remarks documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here if applicable.
GetReturns(Member)publicReturns the first returns documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here if applicable.
GetSeeAlso(Member)publicReturns the seealso documentation elements or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here if applicable.
GetSummary(Member)publicReturns the first summary documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here if applicable.
GetTypeParam(Member, string)publicReturns the first typeparam documentation element with given name or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here.
GetValue(Member)publicReturns the first value documentation element or null if not available. Inheritdoc is taken into the consideration here if applicable.
Param(string)privateReturns the first param documentation element with given name or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.
Read(string)public staticReads the XML Documentation Comments from given xml string
TypeParam(string)privateReturns the first typeparam documentation element with given name or null if not available. Inheritdoc is not taken into the consideration here.

public ExceptionDoc(XElement element)
Constructor parameters
System.Xml.Linq.XElement element
XML element of XML Documentation Comments

Go to namespaces or types

ExceptionDoc.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: ExceptionDoc
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ExceptionDoc.cs

Renders the ExceptionDoc element to string containing the markup provided by markupProvider

protected override string RenderElement(IMarkupProvider markupProvider, Member member, bool trim = true)
Method parameters
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Markup.IMarkupProvider markupProvider
IMarkupProvider allowing using the markup within the rendered content
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.CodeModel.Member member
Code model Member to render the XML Documentation Comment for
bool trim
Flag whether to (full) trim the rendered content

Return value

string
Rendered content of <exception> element of XML Documentation Comments. Important: it returns description list item, so must be encapsulated on higher level !!!
Overrides: ModelElement.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool)

Remarks

Builds the link with the reference according to the cref attribute value. The value represents the Documentation ID that can be matched to the information got during the code analysis or to build the link to MS API reference for the "MS objects". First, it tries to resolve the Member in code being documented (internal link). If not successful, tries to look for the cref (Documentation ID) in the MS API documentation if allowed/available (see MsApiDocEngine for details)

The link text is the the name of linked entity when using internal Link(string, Member) or the cref without the leading type information when rendering . When the link is not constructed ("target unknown"), the cref value without the leading type information is rendered in italic

The <exception> element is then rendered as DescriptionListItem(string, string) where Term is the link and Description is the fully trimmed element content. Important: it returns description list item, so must be encapsulated on higher level !!!

See Also

MsApiDocEngine
MsApiDocOptions

Go to namespaces or types

Go to namespaces or types

List.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: List
Sources: XmlDocumentation\List.cs

Renders the List and its content to string containing the markup provided by markupProvider

protected override string RenderElement(IMarkupProvider markupProvider, Member member, bool trim = true)
Method parameters
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Markup.IMarkupProvider markupProvider
IMarkupProvider allowing using the markup within the rendered content
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.CodeModel.Member member
Code model Member to render the XML Documentation Comment for
bool trim
Flag whether to (full) trim the rendered content

Return value

string
Rendered list element of XML Documentation Comments
Overrides: ModelElement.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool)

Remarks

Gets content of the all child ListItem elements and renders them into the list of required ListType .

  • Bullet list - Each item contains "Term" in bold and "Description" (separated by dash). Both parts are optional. This includes the list header item if present, however, there is no special handling for such item.
  • Numbered list - Each item contains "Term" in bold and "Description" (separated by dash). Both parts are optional. This includes the list header item if present, however, there is no special handling for such item.
  • Table - Rendered as two column table (term and description). Both parts are optional. Header item should be provided to define the table header ("Term" and "Description" are used as defaults)
The rendering uses List<TItemType>(Func<TItemType,string>, IEnumerable<TItemType>, bool) to render the lists and TableHeader(string[]) , TableCols(string[]) and TableFooter() for table rendering. Pseudo-tags TagKeepLineBreak and TagKeepSpace are used in the rendering output, to preserve the whitespaces when the parent element is to be rendered (and its content trimmed)

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElement Class

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElement.cs

Base class for the XML Documentation Comments elements and nodes It's inherited by "known" nodes/elements, itself instanciated when the node/element is not recognized (known).

public class ModelElement

Inheritance: object
Derived: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.C, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Code, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Documentation, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Example, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.List, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.ListItem, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.ModelElementWithCref, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.ModelElementWithName, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Para, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Remarks, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Returns, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Summary, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Text, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.Value

Fields

NameModifierSummary
TagKeepLineBreakprotected staticPseudo-tag used to keep the line break in RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) output
TagKeepSpaceprotected staticPseudo-tag used to keep the space in RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) output

Properties

NameModifierSummary
ElementspublicList of child elements
ElementsProtectedprotectedInternal list of child elements
KindpublicElement name (tag) or "Text" for the Text node

Constructors

NameModifierSummary
ModelElement(XNode)protectedInitialize ModelElement instance from XML Documentation Comments node. Sets the Kind property from the element's tag (for elements only)

Methods

NameModifierSummary
Read(XNode)public staticReads the node from XML - checks the node type (text node + named elements) and calls the appropriate constructor of derived classes. When the element is "unknown", the ModelElement is created. The method is recursively called for all child nodes and the created child objects are inserted into Elements list. This keeps the hierarchy of elements as in XML.
Render(IMarkupProvider, Member)publicRenders the ModelElement and its content to string containing the markup provided by markupProvider . This is the public "entry point" to RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) that does the final adjustment of the whitespaces.
RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool)protectedRenders the ModelElement and its content to string containing the markup provided by markupProvider
ToString()publicReturns the element content as string. It gets the content of all child Elements , merges into single line and trims (full trim)

Go to namespaces or types

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElement.Read(XNode) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: ModelElement
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElement.cs

Reads the node from XML - checks the node type (text node + named elements) and calls the appropriate constructor of derived classes. When the element is "unknown", the ModelElement is created. The method is recursively called for all child nodes and the created child objects are inserted into Elements list. This keeps the hierarchy of elements as in XML.

public static ModelElement Read(XNode node)
Method parameters
System.Xml.Linq.XNode node
XML Documentation Comments node to read

Return value

net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.ModelElement
The element/node class read from XML containing the children in Elements list.

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElement.Render(IMarkupProvider, Member) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: ModelElement
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElement.cs

Renders the ModelElement and its content to string containing the markup provided by markupProvider . This is the public "entry point" to RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) that does the final adjustment of the whitespaces.

public virtual string Render(IMarkupProvider markupProvider, Member member)
Method parameters
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Markup.IMarkupProvider markupProvider
IMarkupProvider allowing using the markup within the rendered content
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.CodeModel.Member member
Code model Member to render the XML Documentation Comment for

Return value

string
Rendered content of element/node of XML Documentation Comments

Remarks

Gets content of the all child Elements and merges it together with a space as a separator. The result is "fully" trimmed - the line breaks are replaced by spaces and leading/ending spaces are removed. Use TagKeepLineBreak and TagKeepSpace in derived classes' RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) to preserve the whitespaces. The Render(IMarkupProvider, Member) method replaces TagKeepLineBreak and TagKeepSpace pseudo-tags back to line breaks and spaces to preserve the "hard" whitespace required by the rendering method

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElement.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: ModelElement
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElement.cs

Renders the ModelElement and its content to string containing the markup provided by markupProvider

protected virtual string RenderElement(IMarkupProvider markupProvider, Member member, bool trim = true)
Method parameters
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Markup.IMarkupProvider markupProvider
IMarkupProvider allowing using the markup within the rendered content
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.CodeModel.Member member
Code model Member to render the XML Documentation Comment for
bool trim
Flag whether to (full) trim the rendered content

Return value

string
Rendered content of element/node of XML Documentation Comments

Remarks

Gets content of the all child Elements and merges it together with a space as a separator. If trim parameter is set, the result is "fully" trimmed - the line breaks are replaced by spaces and leading/ending spaces are removed. The parameter is also propagated to child's RenderElement function when getting the content. Use TagKeepLineBreak and TagKeepSpace in derived classes to preserve the whitespaces. when the parent element is to be rendered (and its content trimmed)

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElement.ToString() Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: ModelElement
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElement.cs

Returns the element content as string. It gets the content of all child Elements , merges into single line and trims (full trim)

public override string ToString()

Return value

string
The element content as string
Overrides: object.ToString

Remarks

Use TagKeepLineBreak and TagKeepSpace in derived classes to preserve the whitespaces.

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElementWithCrefSimple Class

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElementWithCrefSimple.cs

Abstract class representing the element of XML Documentation Comments that have the cref attribute and simple rendering logic - just the link and/or content

public abstract class ModelElementWithCrefSimple : ModelElementWithCref

Inheritance: object -> net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.ModelElement -> net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.ModelElementWithCref
Derived: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.See, net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation.SeeAlso

NameModifierSummary

ToString()publicReturns the element content as string or Ref when there is no content

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElementWithCrefSimple.ModelElementWithCrefSimple(XElement) Constructor

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: ModelElementWithCrefSimple
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElementWithCrefSimple.cs

Initialize ModelElementWithCrefSimple instance from XML Documentation Comments element No logic here

protected ModelElementWithCrefSimple(XElement element)
Constructor parameters
System.Xml.Linq.XElement element
XML element of XML Documentation Comments

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElementWithCrefSimple.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool) Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: ModelElementWithCrefSimple
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElementWithCrefSimple.cs

Renders the element having the cref attribute to string containing the markup provided by markupProvider

protected override string RenderElement(IMarkupProvider markupProvider, Member member, bool trim = true)
Method parameters
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.Markup.IMarkupProvider markupProvider
IMarkupProvider allowing using the markup within the rendered content
net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.CodeModel.Member member
Code model Member to render the XML Documentation Comment for
bool trim
Flag whether to (full) trim the rendered content

Return value

string
Rendered content of element of XML Documentation Comments
Overrides: ModelElement.RenderElement(IMarkupProvider, Member, bool)

Remarks

Builds the link with the reference according to the cref attribute value. The value represents the Documentation ID that can be matched to the information got during the code analysis or to build the link to MS API reference for the "MS objects". First, it tries to resolve the Member in code being documented (internal link). If not successful, tries to look for the cref (Documentation ID) in the MS API documentation if allowed/available (see MsApiDocEngine for details)

The link text is the rendered trimmed content of the tag if available, the name of linked entity when using internal Link(string, Member) or the cref without the leading type information when rendering ExternalLink(string, string) . When the link is not constructed ("target unknown"), the cref value without the leading type information is rendered in italic

See Also

MsApiDocEngine
MsApiDocOptions

Go to namespaces or types

ModelElementWithCrefSimple.ToString() Method

Namespace: net.adamec.dev.markupdoc.XmlDocumentation
Assembly: MarkupDoc
Type: ModelElementWithCrefSimple
Sources: XmlDocumentation\ModelElementWithCrefSimple.cs

Returns the element content as string or Ref when there is no content

public override string ToString()

Return value

string
The element content as string or Ref when there is no content
Overrides: ModelElementWithCref.ToString()

Go to namespaces or types

Constants

NameValueSummary
Bullet0Render as bullet list. Each item contains "Term" in bold and "Description" (separated by dash). Both parts are optional.
Number1Render as numbered list. Each item contains "Term" in bold and "Description" (separated by dash). Both parts are optional.
Table2Render as two column table (term and description). Header item should be provided to define the table header ("Term" and "Description" are used as defaults)
